pytrino.demo

pytrino.demo.pysolvers

class pytrino.demo.pysolvers.CayleyHamilton(*args: float)[source]

Bases: Solver

Solver subclass to compute oscillation probabilities by

  1. Calculating eigenvalues of Hamiltonian in matter.

  2. Computing evolution matrix using the Cayley-Hamilton formalism (See https://arxiv.org/abs/hep-ph/0402175 for more info)

  3. Compute oscillation probabilites using evolution matrix.

class pytrino.demo.pysolvers.Eigen(*args: float)[source]

Bases: Solver

Solver subclass to compute oscillation probabilities by

  1. Calculating eigenvalues and eigenvectors of Hamiltonian in matter (thereby diagonalizing said Hamiltonian).

  2. Computing evolution matrix using said eigenvalues and eigenvectors

  3. Compute oscillation probabilites using evolution matrix.

class pytrino.demo.pysolvers.Identities(*args: float)[source]

Bases: Solver

Solver subclass to compute matter oscillation properties by

  1. Calculating eigenvalues of submatrices of the Hamiltonian in matter.

  2. Computing modulus squared of the elements of the PMNS matrix in matter using the Eigenvalue-Eigenvector identity (See https://arxiv.org/abs/1907.02534 for more info).

  3. Computing quartic products of the elements of the PMNS matrix in matter using the Adjugate identity (See https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.12565 for more info).

  4. Using these quantities to compute probabilities for appearance and disappearance channels.

  5. Implementing subroutines to explicitly compute mass squared differences, mixing angles + CP phase, and PMNS matrix in matter.

PMNS_matter(baseline: float, energy: float, V: float, antineutrinos: bool = False) → matrix[source]

Calculates the PMNS matrix in matter for the given parameters.

See https://arxiv.org/abs/1907.02534 for more info.

Parameters:

  • baseline (float) – The baseline length in km.

  • energy (float) – The neutrino beam energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – The effective (constant) matter potential in eV.

  • antineutrinos (bool, optional) – Flag indicating whether to compute for antineutrinos. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The PMNS matrix in matter.

Return type:

matrix

angles_phase_matter(baseline: float, energy: float, V: float, antineutrinos: bool = False) → Tuple[float, float, float, float][source]

Calculates the mixing angles and CP-violating phase in matter for the given parameters.

See https://arxiv.org/abs/1907.02534 for more info.

Parameters:

  • baseline (float) – The baseline length in km.

  • energy (float) – The neutrino beam energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – The effective (constant) matter potential in eV.

  • antineutrinos (bool, optional) – Flag indicating whether to compute for antineutrinos. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The CP phase and mixing angles in matter in radians.

Return type:

Tuple[float, float, float, float]

deltamsq_matter(baseline: float, energy: float, V: float, antineutrinos: bool = False) → Tuple[float, float, float][source]

Calculates the mass squared differences in matter for the given parameters.

Parameters:

  • baseline (float) – The baseline length in km.

  • energy (float) – The neutrino beam energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – The effective (constant) matter potential in eV.

  • antineutrinos (bool, optional) – Flag indicating whether to compute for antineutrinos. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The mass squared differences in matter in eV^2.

Return type:

Tuple[float, float, float]

probability(i: int, j: int, baseline: float, energy: float, V: float, antineutrinos: bool = False) → float[source]

Compute the neutrino oscillation probability for a given channel.

Parameters:

  • i (int) – Flavor index i.

  • j (int) – Flavor index j.

  • baseline (float) – Baseline length in km.

  • energy (float) – Neutrino energy in GeV.

  • V (float) – Effective (constant) matter potential in eV.

  • antineutrinos (bool) – Flag indicating whether to compute for antineutrinos (default is False).

Returns:

The neutrino/antineutrino oscillation probability.

Return type:

float

class pytrino.demo.pysolvers.Solver(delmsq21: float, delmsq31: float, deltacp: float, theta12: float, theta13: float, theta23: float)[source]

Bases: object

Solver superclass for neutrino oscillation calculations.

Parameters:

  • delmsq21 (float) – Mass squared difference between the second and first neutrino mass eigenstates in eV^2

  • delmsq31 (float) – Mass squared difference between the third and first neutrino mass eigenstates in eV^2

  • deltacp (float) – The Dirac CP-violating phase in vacuum in radians

  • theta12 (float) – Mixing angle θ12 in radians

  • theta13 (float) – Mixing angle θ13 in radians

  • theta23 (float) – Mixing angle θ23 in radians

  • _O12 – theta12 rotation matrix.

  • _O13 – theta13 rotation matrix.

  • _O23 – theta23 rotation matrix

  • _Udelta – Unitary CP phase matrix.

  • _H – Hamiltonian in matter

  • baseline – The baseline length in km

  • energy – The neutrino beam energy in GeV

  • V – The effective (constant) matter potential in eV

alpha() → float[source]

Compute the mass-hierarchy parameter α.

Returns:

The value of α.

Return type:

float

probability(i: int, j: int, baseline: float, energy: float, V: float, antineutrinos: bool = False) → float[source]

Compute the neutrino oscillation probability from flavor i to flavor j.

Parameters:

  • i (int) – Initial flavor index (e = 1, mu = 2, tau = 3).

  • j (int) – Final flavor index (e = 1, mu = 2, tau = 3).

  • baseline (float) – The baseline length in km

  • energy (float) – The neutrino beam energy in GeV

  • V (float) – The effective (constant) matter potential in eV

  • antineutrinos (bool) – Flag indicating whether to compute for antineutrinos (True) or neutrinos (False).

Returns:

The oscillation probability.

Return type:

float

probmatrix(baseline: float, energy: float, V: float, antineutrinos: bool = False, labels: bool = False) → ndarray[source]

Compute the neutrino oscillation probability matrix.

Parameters:

  • baseline (float) – The baseline length in km

  • energy (float) – The neutrino beam energy in GeV

  • V (float) – The effective (constant) matter potential in eV

  • antineutrinos (bool) – Flag indicating whether to compute for antineutrinos (True) or neutrinos (False).

  • labels (bool) – Flag indicating whether to include labels in the output matrix.

Returns:

The neutrino/antineutrino oscillation probability matrix.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray
